lines.value: ORLANDO
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: As I remember, Adam, it was upon this fashion
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: bequeathed me by will but poor a thousand crowns,
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: and, as thou sayest, charged my brother, on his
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: blessing, to breed me well: and there begins my
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: sadness. My brother Jaques he keeps at school, and
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: report speaks goldenly of his profit: for my part,
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: he keeps me rustically at home, or, to speak more
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: properly, stays me here at home unkept; for call you
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: that keeping for a gentleman of my birth, that
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: differs not from the stalling of an ox? His horses
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: are bred better; for, besides that they are fair
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: with their feeding, they are taught their manage,
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: and to that end riders dearly hired: but I, his
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: brother, gain nothing under him but growth; for the
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: which his animals on his dunghills are as much
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: bound to him as I. Besides this nothing that he so
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: plentifully gives me, the something that nature gave
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: me his countenance seems to take from me: he lets
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: me feed with his hinds, bars me the place of a
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: brother, and, as much as in him lies, mines my
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: gentility with my education. This is it, Adam, that
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: grieves me; and the spirit of my father, which I
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: think is within me, begins to mutiny against this
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: servitude: I will no longer endure it, though yet I
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: know no wise remedy how to avoid it.
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: ADAM
lines.speaker: ADAM

lines.value: Yonder comes my master, your brother.
lines.speaker: ADAM

lines.value: ORLANDO
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: Go apart, Adam, and thou shalt hear how he will
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: shake me up.
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: OLIVER
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: Now, sir! what make you here?
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: ORLANDO
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: Nothing: I am not taught to make any thing.
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: OLIVER
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: What mar you then, sir?
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: ORLANDO
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: Marry, sir, I am helping you to mar that which God
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: made, a poor unworthy brother of yours, with idleness.
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: OLIVER
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: Marry, sir, be better employed, and be naught awhile.
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: ORLANDO
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: Shall I keep your hogs and eat husks with them?
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: What prodigal portion have I spent, that I should
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: come to such penury?
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: OLIVER
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: Know you where your are, sir?
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: ORLANDO
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: O, sir, very well; here in your orchard.
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: OLIVER
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: Know you before whom, sir?
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: ORLANDO
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: Ay, better than him I am before knows me. I know
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: you are my eldest brother; and, in the gentle
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: condition of blood, you should so know me. The
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: courtesy of nations allows you my better, in that
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: you are the first-born; but the same tradition
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: takes not away my blood, were there twenty brothers
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: betwixt us: I have as much of my father in me as
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: you; albeit, I confess, your coming before me is
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: nearer to his reverence.
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: OLIVER
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: What, boy!
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: ORLANDO
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: Come, come, elder brother, you are too young in this.
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: OLIVER
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: Wilt thou lay hands on me, villain?
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: ORLANDO
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: I am no villain; I am the youngest son of Sir
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: Rowland de Boys; he was my father, and he is thrice
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: a villain that says such a father begot villains.
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: Wert thou not my brother, I would not take this hand
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: from thy throat till this other had pulled out thy
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: tongue for saying so: thou hast railed on thyself.
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: ADAM
lines.speaker: ADAM

lines.value: Sweet masters, be patient: for your father's
lines.speaker: ADAM

lines.value: remembrance, be at accord.
lines.speaker: ADAM

lines.value: OLIVER
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: Let me go, I say.
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: ORLANDO
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: I will not, till I please: you shall hear me. My
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: father charged you in his will to give me good
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: education: you have trained me like a peasant,
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: obscuring and hiding from me all gentleman-like
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: qualities. The spirit of my father grows strong in
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: me, and I will no longer endure it: therefore allow
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: me such exercises as may become a gentleman, or
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: give me the poor allottery my father left me by
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: testament; with that I will go buy my fortunes.
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: OLIVER
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: And what wilt thou do? beg, when that is spent?
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: Well, sir, get you in: I will not long be troubled
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: with you; you shall have some part of your will: I
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: pray you, leave me.
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: ORLANDO
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: I will no further offend you than becomes me for my good.
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: OLIVER
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: Get you with him, you old dog.
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: ADAM
lines.speaker: ADAM

lines.value: Is 'old dog' my reward? Most true, I have lost my
lines.speaker: ADAM

lines.value: teeth in your service. God be with my old master!
lines.speaker: ADAM

lines.value: he would not have spoke such a word.
lines.speaker: ADAM

lines.value: OLIVER
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: Is it even so? begin you to grow upon me? I will
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: physic your rankness, and yet give no thousand
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: crowns neither. Holla, Dennis!
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: DENNIS
lines.speaker: DENNIS

lines.value: Calls your worship?
lines.speaker: DENNIS

lines.value: OLIVER
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: Was not Charles, the duke's wrestler, here to speak with me?
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: DENNIS
lines.speaker: DENNIS

lines.value: So please you, he is here at the door and importunes
lines.speaker: DENNIS

lines.value: access to you.
lines.speaker: DENNIS

lines.value: OLIVER
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: Call him in.
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: 'Twill be a good way; and to-morrow the wrestling is.
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: CHARLES
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: Good morrow to your worship.
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: OLIVER
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: Good Monsieur Charles, what's the new news at the
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: new court?
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: CHARLES
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: There's no news at the court, sir, but the old news:
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: that is, the old duke is banished by his younger
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: brother the new duke; and three or four loving lords
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: have put themselves into voluntary exile with him,
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: whose lands and revenues enrich the new duke;
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: therefore he gives them good leave to wander.
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: OLIVER
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: Can you tell if Rosalind, the duke's daughter, be
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: banished with her father?
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: CHARLES
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: O, no; for the duke's daughter, her cousin, so loves
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: her, being ever from their cradles bred together,
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: that she would have followed her exile, or have died
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: to stay behind her. She is at the court, and no
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: less beloved of her uncle than his own daughter; and
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: never two ladies loved as they do.
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: OLIVER
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: Where will the old duke live?
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: CHARLES
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: They say he is already in the forest of Arden, and
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: a many merry men with him; and there they live like
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: the old Robin Hood of England: they say many young
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: gentlemen flock to him every day, and fleet the time
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: carelessly, as they did in the golden world.
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: OLIVER
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: What, you wrestle to-morrow before the new duke?
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: CHARLES
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: Marry, do I, sir; and I came to acquaint you with a
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: matter. I am given, sir, secretly to understand
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: that your younger brother Orlando hath a disposition
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: to come in disguised against me to try a fall.
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: To-morrow, sir, I wrestle for my credit; and he that
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: escapes me without some broken limb shall acquit him
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: well. Your brother is but young and tender; and,
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: for your love, I would be loath to foil him, as I
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: must, for my own honour, if he come in: therefore,
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: out of my love to you, I came hither to acquaint you
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: withal, that either you might stay him from his
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: intendment or brook such disgrace well as he shall
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: run into, in that it is a thing of his own search
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: and altogether against my will.
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: OLIVER
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: Charles, I thank thee for thy love to me, which
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: thou shalt find I will most kindly requite. I had
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: myself notice of my brother's purpose herein and
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: have by underhand means laboured to dissuade him from
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: it, but he is resolute. I'll tell thee, Charles:
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: it is the stubbornest young fellow of France, full
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: of ambition, an envious emulator of every man's
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: good parts, a secret and villanous contriver against
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: me his natural brother: therefore use thy
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: discretion; I had as lief thou didst break his neck
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: as his finger. And thou wert best look to't; for if
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: thou dost him any slight disgrace or if he do not
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: mightily grace himself on thee, he will practise
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: against thee by poison, entrap thee by some
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: treacherous device and never leave thee till he
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: hath ta'en thy life by some indirect means or other;
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: for, I assure thee, and almost with tears I speak
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: it, there is not one so young and so villanous this
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: day living. I speak but brotherly of him; but
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: should I anatomize him to thee as he is, I must
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: blush and weep and thou must look pale and wonder.
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: CHARLES
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: I am heartily glad I came hither to you. If he come
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: to-morrow, I'll give him his payment: if ever he go
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: alone again, I'll never wrestle for prize more: and
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: so God keep your worship!
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: OLIVER
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: Farewell, good Charles.
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: Now will I stir this gamester: I hope I shall see
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: an end of him; for my soul, yet I know not why,
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: hates nothing more than he. Yet he's gentle, never
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: schooled and yet learned, full of noble device, of
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: all sorts enchantingly beloved, and indeed so much
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: in the heart of the world, and especially of my own
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: people, who best know him, that I am altogether
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: misprised: but it shall not be so long; this
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: wrestler shall clear all: nothing remains but that
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: I kindle the boy thither; which now I'll go about.
lines.speaker: OLIVER

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: I pray thee, Rosalind, sweet my coz, be merry.
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: Dear Celia, I show more mirth than I am mistress of;
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: and would you yet I were merrier? Unless you could
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: teach me to forget a banished father, you must not
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: learn me how to remember any extraordinary pleasure.
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: Herein I see thou lovest me not with the full weight
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: that I love thee. If my uncle, thy banished father,
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: had banished thy uncle, the duke my father, so thou
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: hadst been still with me, I could have taught my
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: love to take thy father for mine: so wouldst thou,
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: if the truth of thy love to me were so righteously
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: tempered as mine is to thee.
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: Well, I will forget the condition of my estate, to
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: rejoice in yours.
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: You know my father hath no child but I, nor none is
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: like to have: and, truly, when he dies, thou shalt
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: be his heir, for what he hath taken away from thy
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: father perforce, I will render thee again in
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: affection; by mine honour, I will; and when I break
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: that oath, let me turn monster: therefore, my
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: sweet Rose, my dear Rose, be merry.
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: From henceforth I will, coz, and devise sports. Let
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: me see; what think you of falling in love?
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: Marry, I prithee, do, to make sport withal: but
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: love no man in good earnest; nor no further in sport
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: neither than with safety of a pure blush thou mayst
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: in honour come off again.
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: What shall be our sport, then?
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: Let us sit and mock the good housewife Fortune from
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: her wheel, that her gifts may henceforth be bestowed equally.
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: I would we could do so, for her benefits are
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: mightily misplaced, and the bountiful blind woman
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: doth most mistake in her gifts to women.
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: 'Tis true; for those that she makes fair she scarce
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: makes honest, and those that she makes honest she
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: makes very ill-favouredly.
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: Nay, now thou goest from Fortune's office to
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: Nature's: Fortune reigns in gifts of the world,
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: not in the lineaments of Nature.
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: No? when Nature hath made a fair creature, may she
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: not by Fortune fall into the fire? Though Nature
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: hath given us wit to flout at Fortune, hath not
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: Fortune sent in this fool to cut off the argument?
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: Indeed, there is Fortune too hard for Nature, when
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: Fortune makes Nature's natural the cutter-off of
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: Nature's wit.
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: Peradventure this is not Fortune's work neither, but
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: Nature's; who perceiveth our natural wits too dull
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: to reason of such goddesses and hath sent this
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: natural for our whetstone; for always the dulness of
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: the fool is the whetstone of the wits. How now,
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: wit! whither wander you?
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: TOUCHSTONE
lines.speaker: TOUCHSTONE

lines.value: Mistress, you must come away to your father.
lines.speaker: TOUCHSTONE

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: Were you made the messenger?
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: TOUCHSTONE
lines.speaker: TOUCHSTONE

lines.value: No, by mine honour, but I was bid to come for you.
lines.speaker: TOUCHSTONE

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: Where learned you that oath, fool?
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: TOUCHSTONE
lines.speaker: TOUCHSTONE

lines.value: Of a certain knight that swore by his honour they
lines.speaker: TOUCHSTONE

lines.value: were good pancakes and swore by his honour the
lines.speaker: TOUCHSTONE

lines.value: mustard was naught: now I'll stand to it, the
lines.speaker: TOUCHSTONE

lines.value: pancakes were naught and the mustard was good, and
lines.speaker: TOUCHSTONE

lines.value: yet was not the knight forsworn.
lines.speaker: TOUCHSTONE

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: How prove you that, in the great heap of your
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: knowledge?
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: Ay, marry, now unmuzzle your wisdom.
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: TOUCHSTONE
lines.speaker: TOUCHSTONE

lines.value: Stand you both forth now: stroke your chins, and
lines.speaker: TOUCHSTONE

lines.value: swear by your beards that I am a knave.
lines.speaker: TOUCHSTONE

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: By our beards, if we had them, thou art.
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: TOUCHSTONE
lines.speaker: TOUCHSTONE

lines.value: By my knavery, if I had it, then I were; but if you
lines.speaker: TOUCHSTONE

lines.value: swear by that that is not, you are not forsworn: no
lines.speaker: TOUCHSTONE

lines.value: more was this knight swearing by his honour, for he
lines.speaker: TOUCHSTONE

lines.value: never had any; or if he had, he had sworn it away
lines.speaker: TOUCHSTONE

lines.value: before ever he saw those pancakes or that mustard.
lines.speaker: TOUCHSTONE

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: Prithee, who is't that thou meanest?
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: TOUCHSTONE
lines.speaker: TOUCHSTONE

lines.value: One that old Frederick, your father, loves.
lines.speaker: TOUCHSTONE

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: My father's love is enough to honour him: enough!
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: speak no more of him; you'll be whipped for taxation
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: one of these days.
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: TOUCHSTONE
lines.speaker: TOUCHSTONE

lines.value: The more pity, that fools may not speak wisely what
lines.speaker: TOUCHSTONE

lines.value: wise men do foolishly.
lines.speaker: TOUCHSTONE

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: By my troth, thou sayest true; for since the little
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: wit that fools have was silenced, the little foolery
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: that wise men have makes a great show. Here comes
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: Monsieur Le Beau.
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: With his mouth full of news.
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: Which he will put on us, as pigeons feed their young.
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: Then shall we be news-crammed.
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: All the better; we shall be the more marketable.
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: Bon jour, Monsieur Le Beau: what's the news?
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: LE BEAU
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: Fair princess, you have lost much good sport.
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: Sport! of what colour?
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: LE BEAU
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: What colour, madam! how shall I answer you?
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: As wit and fortune will.
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: TOUCHSTONE
lines.speaker: TOUCHSTONE

lines.value: Or as the Destinies decree.
lines.speaker: TOUCHSTONE

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: Well said: that was laid on with a trowel.
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: TOUCHSTONE
lines.speaker: TOUCHSTONE

lines.value: Nay, if I keep not my rank,--
lines.speaker: TOUCHSTONE

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: Thou losest thy old smell.
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: LE BEAU
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: You amaze me, ladies: I would have told you of good
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: wrestling, which you have lost the sight of.
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: You tell us the manner of the wrestling.
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: LE BEAU
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: I will tell you the beginning; and, if it please
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: your ladyships, you may see the end; for the best is
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: yet to do; and here, where you are, they are coming
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: to perform it.
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: Well, the beginning, that is dead and buried.
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: LE BEAU
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: There comes an old man and his three sons,--
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: I could match this beginning with an old tale.
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: LE BEAU
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: Three proper young men, of excellent growth and presence.
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: With bills on their necks, 'Be it known unto all men
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: by these presents.'
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: LE BEAU
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: The eldest of the three wrestled with Charles, the
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: duke's wrestler; which Charles in a moment threw him
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: and broke three of his ribs, that there is little
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: hope of life in him: so he served the second, and
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: so the third. Yonder they lie; the poor old man,
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: their father, making such pitiful dole over them
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: that all the beholders take his part with weeping.
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: Alas!
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: TOUCHSTONE
lines.speaker: TOUCHSTONE

lines.value: But what is the sport, monsieur, that the ladies
lines.speaker: TOUCHSTONE

lines.value: have lost?
lines.speaker: TOUCHSTONE

lines.value: LE BEAU
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: Why, this that I speak of.
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: TOUCHSTONE
lines.speaker: TOUCHSTONE

lines.value: Thus men may grow wiser every day: it is the first
lines.speaker: TOUCHSTONE

lines.value: time that ever I heard breaking of ribs was sport
lines.speaker: TOUCHSTONE

lines.value: for ladies.
lines.speaker: TOUCHSTONE

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: Or I, I promise thee.
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: But is there any else longs to see this broken music
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: in his sides? is there yet another dotes upon
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: rib-breaking? Shall we see this wrestling, cousin?
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: LE BEAU
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: You must, if you stay here; for here is the place
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: appointed for the wrestling, and they are ready to
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: perform it.
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: Yonder, sure, they are coming: let us now stay and see it.
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: DUKE FREDERICK
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: Come on: since the youth will not be entreated, his
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: own peril on his forwardness.
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: Is yonder the man?
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: LE BEAU
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: Even he, madam.
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: Alas, he is too young! yet he looks successfully.
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: DUKE FREDERICK
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: How now, daughter and cousin! are you crept hither
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: to see the wrestling?
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: Ay, my liege, so please you give us leave.
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: DUKE FREDERICK
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: You will take little delight in it, I can tell you;
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: there is such odds in the man. In pity of the
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: challenger's youth I would fain dissuade him, but he
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: will not be entreated. Speak to him, ladies; see if
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: you can move him.
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: Call him hither, good Monsieur Le Beau.
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: DUKE FREDERICK
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: Do so: I'll not be by.
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: LE BEAU
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: Monsieur the challenger, the princesses call for you.
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: ORLANDO
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: I attend them with all respect and duty.
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: Young man, have you challenged Charles the wrestler?
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: ORLANDO
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: No, fair princess; he is the general challenger: I
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: come but in, as others do, to try with him the
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: strength of my youth.
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: Young gentleman, your spirits are too bold for your
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: years. You have seen cruel proof of this man's
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: strength: if you saw yourself with your eyes or
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: knew yourself with your judgment, the fear of your
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: adventure would counsel you to a more equal
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: enterprise. We pray you, for your own sake, to
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: embrace your own safety and give over this attempt.
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: Do, young sir; your reputation shall not therefore
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: be misprised: we will make it our suit to the duke
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: that the wrestling might not go forward.
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: ORLANDO
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: I beseech you, punish me not with your hard
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: thoughts; wherein I confess me much guilty, to deny
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: so fair and excellent ladies any thing. But let
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: your fair eyes and gentle wishes go with me to my
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: trial: wherein if I be foiled, there is but one
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: shamed that was never gracious; if killed, but one
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: dead that was willing to be so: I shall do my
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: friends no wrong, for I have none to lament me, the
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: world no injury, for in it I have nothing; only in
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: the world I fill up a place, which may be better
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: supplied when I have made it empty.
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: The little strength that I have, I would it were with you.
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: And mine, to eke out hers.
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: Fare you well: pray heaven I be deceived in you!
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: Your heart's desires be with you!
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: CHARLES
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: Come, where is this young gallant that is so
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: desirous to lie with his mother earth?
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: ORLANDO
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: Ready, sir; but his will hath in it a more modest working.
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: DUKE FREDERICK
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: You shall try but one fall.
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: CHARLES
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: No, I warrant your grace, you shall not entreat him
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: to a second, that have so mightily persuaded him
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: from a first.
lines.speaker: CHARLES

lines.value: ORLANDO
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: An you mean to mock me after, you should not have
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: mocked me before: but come your ways.
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: Now Hercules be thy speed, young man!
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: I would I were invisible, to catch the strong
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: fellow by the leg.
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: O excellent young man!
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: If I had a thunderbolt in mine eye, I can tell who
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: should down.
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: DUKE FREDERICK
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: No more, no more.
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: ORLANDO
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: Yes, I beseech your grace: I am not yet well breathed.
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: DUKE FREDERICK
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: How dost thou, Charles?
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: LE BEAU
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: He cannot speak, my lord.
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: DUKE FREDERICK
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: Bear him away. What is thy name, young man?
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: ORLANDO
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: Orlando, my liege; the youngest son of Sir Rowland de Boys.
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: DUKE FREDERICK
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: I would thou hadst been son to some man else:
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: The world esteem'd thy father honourable,
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: But I did find him still mine enemy:
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: Thou shouldst have better pleased me with this deed,
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: Hadst thou descended from another house.
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: But fare thee well; thou art a gallant youth:
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: I would thou hadst told me of another father.
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: Were I my father, coz, would I do this?
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: ORLANDO
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: I am more proud to be Sir Rowland's son,
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: His youngest son; and would not change that calling,
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: To be adopted heir to Frederick.
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: My father loved Sir Rowland as his soul,
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: And all the world was of my father's mind:
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: Had I before known this young man his son,
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: I should have given him tears unto entreaties,
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: Ere he should thus have ventured.
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: Gentle cousin,
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: Let us go thank him and encourage him:
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: My father's rough and envious disposition
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: Sticks me at heart. Sir, you have well deserved:
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: If you do keep your promises in love
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: But justly, as you have exceeded all promise,
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: Your mistress shall be happy.
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: Gentleman,
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: Wear this for me, one out of suits with fortune,
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: That could give more, but that her hand lacks means.
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: Shall we go, coz?
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: Ay. Fare you well, fair gentleman.
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: ORLANDO
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: Can I not say, I thank you? My better parts
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: Are all thrown down, and that which here stands up
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: Is but a quintain, a mere lifeless block.
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: He calls us back: my pride fell with my fortunes;
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: I'll ask him what he would. Did you call, sir?
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: Sir, you have wrestled well and overthrown
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: More than your enemies.
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: Will you go, coz?
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: Have with you. Fare you well.
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: ORLANDO
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: What passion hangs these weights upon my tongue?
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: I cannot speak to her, yet she urged conference.
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: O poor Orlando, thou art overthrown!
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: Or Charles or something weaker masters thee.
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: LE BEAU
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: Good sir, I do in friendship counsel you
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: To leave this place. Albeit you have deserved
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: High commendation, true applause and love,
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: Yet such is now the duke's condition
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: That he misconstrues all that you have done.
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: The duke is humorous; what he is indeed,
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: More suits you to conceive than I to speak of.
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: ORLANDO
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: I thank you, sir: and, pray you, tell me this:
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: Which of the two was daughter of the duke
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: That here was at the wrestling?
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: LE BEAU
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: Neither his daughter, if we judge by manners;
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: But yet indeed the lesser is his daughter
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: The other is daughter to the banish'd duke,
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: And here detain'd by her usurping uncle,
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: To keep his daughter company; whose loves
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: Are dearer than the natural bond of sisters.
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: But I can tell you that of late this duke
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: Hath ta'en displeasure 'gainst his gentle niece,
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: Grounded upon no other argument
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: But that the people praise her for her virtues
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: And pity her for her good father's sake;
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: And, on my life, his malice 'gainst the lady
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: Will suddenly break forth. Sir, fare you well:
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: Hereafter, in a better world than this,
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: I shall desire more love and knowledge of you.
lines.speaker: LE BEAU

lines.value: ORLANDO
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: I rest much bounden to you: fare you well.
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: Thus must I from the smoke into the smother;
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: From tyrant duke unto a tyrant brother:
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: But heavenly Rosalind!
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: Why, cousin! why, Rosalind! Cupid have mercy! not a word?
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: Not one to throw at a dog.
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: No, thy words are too precious to be cast away upon
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: curs; throw some of them at me; come, lame me with reasons.
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: Then there were two cousins laid up; when the one
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: should be lamed with reasons and the other mad
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: without any.
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: But is all this for your father?
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: No, some of it is for my child's father. O, how
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: full of briers is this working-day world!
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: They are but burs, cousin, thrown upon thee in
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: holiday foolery: if we walk not in the trodden
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: paths our very petticoats will catch them.
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: I could shake them off my coat: these burs are in my heart.
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: Hem them away.
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: I would try, if I could cry 'hem' and have him.
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: Come, come, wrestle with thy affections.
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: O, they take the part of a better wrestler than myself!
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: O, a good wish upon you! you will try in time, in
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: despite of a fall. But, turning these jests out of
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: service, let us talk in good earnest: is it
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: possible, on such a sudden, you should fall into so
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: strong a liking with old Sir Rowland's youngest son?
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: The duke my father loved his father dearly.
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: Doth it therefore ensue that you should love his son
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: dearly? By this kind of chase, I should hate him,
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: for my father hated his father dearly; yet I hate
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: not Orlando.
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: No, faith, hate him not, for my sake.
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: Why should I not? doth he not deserve well?
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: Let me love him for that, and do you love him
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: because I do. Look, here comes the duke.
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: With his eyes full of anger.
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: DUKE FREDERICK
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: Mistress, dispatch you with your safest haste
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: And get you from our court.
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: Me, uncle?
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: DUKE FREDERICK
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: You, cousin
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: Within these ten days if that thou be'st found
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: So near our public court as twenty miles,
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: Thou diest for it.
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: I do beseech your grace,
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: Let me the knowledge of my fault bear with me:
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: If with myself I hold intelligence
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: Or have acquaintance with mine own desires,
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: If that I do not dream or be not frantic,--
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: As I do trust I am not--then, dear uncle,
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: Never so much as in a thought unborn
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: Did I offend your highness.
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: DUKE FREDERICK
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: Thus do all traitors:
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: If their purgation did consist in words,
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: They are as innocent as grace itself:
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: Let it suffice thee that I trust thee not.
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: Yet your mistrust cannot make me a traitor:
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: Tell me whereon the likelihood depends.

lines.value: DUKE FREDERICK
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: Thou art thy father's daughter; there's enough.
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: So was I when your highness took his dukedom;
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: So was I when your highness banish'd him:
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: Treason is not inherited, my lord;
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: Or, if we did derive it from our friends,
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: What's that to me? my father was no traitor:
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: CELIA

lines.value: Dear sovereign, hear me speak.

lines.value: DUKE FREDERICK
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: Else had she with her father ranged along.
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: I did not then entreat to have her stay;
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: It was your pleasure and your own remorse:
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: I was too young that time to value her;
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: But now I know her: if she be a traitor,
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: Why so am I; we still have slept together,
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: Rose at an instant, learn'd, play'd, eat together,
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: And wheresoever we went, like Juno's swans,
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: Still we went coupled and inseparable.
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: DUKE FREDERICK
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: She is too subtle for thee; and her smoothness,
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: Her very silence and her patience
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: Speak to the people, and they pity her.
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: Thou art a fool: she robs thee of thy name;
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: And thou wilt show more bright and seem more virtuous
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: When she is gone. Then open not thy lips:
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: Firm and irrevocable is my doom
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: Which I have pass'd upon her; she is banish'd.
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: CELIA
lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: CELIA

lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: ROSALIND

lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: CELIA

lines.value: ROSALIND

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: CELIA

lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.speaker: CELIA

lines.value: DUKE SENIOR
lines.speaker: DUKE SENIOR

lines.value: Now, my co-mates and brothers in exile,
lines.speaker: DUKE SENIOR

lines.value: Hath not old custom made this life more sweet
lines.speaker: DUKE SENIOR

lines.value: Than that of painted pomp? Are not these woods
lines.speaker: DUKE SENIOR

lines.value: More free from peril than the envious court?
lines.speaker: DUKE SENIOR

lines.value: Here feel we but the penalty of Adam,
lines.speaker: DUKE SENIOR

lines.value: The seasons' difference, as the icy fang
lines.speaker: DUKE SENIOR

lines.value: And churlish chiding of the winter's wind,
lines.speaker: DUKE SENIOR

lines.value: Which, when it bites and blows upon my body,
lines.speaker: DUKE SENIOR

lines.value: Even till I shrink with cold, I smile and say
lines.speaker: DUKE SENIOR

lines.value: 'This is no flattery: these are counsellors
lines.speaker: DUKE SENIOR

lines.value: That feelingly persuade me what I am.'
lines.speaker: DUKE SENIOR

lines.value: Sweet are the uses of adversity,
lines.speaker: DUKE SENIOR

lines.value: Which, like the toad, ugly and venomous,
lines.speaker: DUKE SENIOR

lines.value: Wears yet a precious jewel in his head;
lines.speaker: DUKE SENIOR

lines.value: And this our life exempt from public haunt
lines.speaker: DUKE SENIOR

lines.value: Finds tongues in trees, books in the running brooks,
lines.speaker: DUKE SENIOR

lines.value: Sermons in stones and good in every thing.
lines.speaker: DUKE SENIOR

lines.value: I would not change it.
lines.speaker: DUKE SENIOR

lines.speaker: JAQUES

lines.value: Says very wisely, 'It is ten o'clock:
lines.speaker: JAQUES

lines.speaker: JAQUES

lines.speaker: JAQUES

lines.speaker: JAQUES

lines.speaker: JAQUES

lines.speaker: JAQUES

lines.speaker: JAQUES

lines.value: You touch'd my vein at first: the thorny point
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: Of bare distress hath ta'en from me the show
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: Of smooth civility: yet am I inland bred
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: And know some nurture. But forbear, I say:
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: He dies that touches any of this fruit
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: Till I and my affairs are answered.
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: JAQUES
lines.speaker: JAQUES

lines.value: An you will not be answered with reason, I must die.
lines.speaker: JAQUES

lines.value: DUKE SENIOR
lines.speaker: DUKE SENIOR

lines.value: What would you have? Your gentleness shall force
lines.speaker: DUKE SENIOR

lines.value: More than your force move us to gentleness.
lines.speaker: DUKE SENIOR

lines.value: ORLANDO
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: I almost die for food; and let me have it.
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: DUKE SENIOR
lines.speaker: DUKE SENIOR

lines.value: Sit down and feed, and welcome to our table.
lines.speaker: DUKE SENIOR

lines.value: ORLANDO
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: Speak you so gently? Pardon me, I pray you:
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: I thought that all things had been savage here;
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: And therefore put I on the countenance
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: Of stern commandment. But whate'er you are
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: That in this desert inaccessible,
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: Under the shade of melancholy boughs,
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: Lose and neglect the creeping hours of time
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: If ever you have look'd on better days,
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: If ever been where bells have knoll'd to church,
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: If ever sat at any good man's feast,
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: If ever from your eyelids wiped a tear
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: And know what 'tis to pity and be pitied,
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: Let gentleness my strong enforcement be:
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: In the which hope I blush, and hide my sword.
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: DUKE SENIOR
lines.speaker: DUKE SENIOR

lines.value: True is it that we have seen better days,
lines.speaker: DUKE SENIOR

lines.value: And have with holy bell been knoll'd to church
lines.speaker: DUKE SENIOR

lines.value: And sat at good men's feasts and wiped our eyes
lines.speaker: DUKE SENIOR

lines.value: Of drops that sacred pity hath engender'd:
lines.speaker: DUKE SENIOR

lines.value: And therefore sit you down in gentleness
lines.speaker: DUKE SENIOR

lines.value: And take upon command what help we have
lines.speaker: DUKE SENIOR

lines.value: That to your wanting may be minister'd.
lines.speaker: DUKE SENIOR

lines.value: ORLANDO
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: Then but forbear your food a little while,
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: Whiles, like a doe, I go to find my fawn
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: And give it food. There is an old poor man,
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: Who after me hath many a weary step
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: Limp'd in pure love: till he be first sufficed,
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: Oppress'd with two weak evils, age and hunger,
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: I will not touch a bit.
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: DUKE SENIOR
lines.speaker: DUKE SENIOR

lines.value: Go find him out,
lines.speaker: DUKE SENIOR

lines.value: And we will nothing waste till you return.
lines.speaker: DUKE SENIOR

lines.value: ORLANDO
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: I thank ye; and be blest for your good comfort!
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: DUKE SENIOR
lines.speaker: DUKE SENIOR

lines.value: Thou seest we are not all alone unhappy:
lines.speaker: DUKE SENIOR

lines.value: This wide and universal theatre
lines.speaker: DUKE SENIOR

lines.value: Presents more woeful pageants than the scene
lines.speaker: DUKE SENIOR

lines.value: Wherein we play in.
lines.speaker: DUKE SENIOR

lines.value: JAQUES
lines.speaker: JAQUES

lines.value: All the world's a stage,
lines.speaker: JAQUES

lines.value: And all the men and women merely players:
lines.speaker: JAQUES

lines.value: They have their exits and their entrances;
lines.speaker: JAQUES

lines.value: And one man in his time plays many parts,
lines.speaker: JAQUES

lines.value: His acts being seven ages. At first the infant,
lines.speaker: JAQUES

lines.value: Mewling and puking in the nurse's arms.
lines.speaker: JAQUES

lines.value: And then the whining school-boy, with his satchel
lines.speaker: JAQUES

lines.value: And shining morning face, creeping like snail
lines.speaker: JAQUES

lines.value: Unwillingly to school. And then the lover,
lines.speaker: JAQUES

lines.value: Sighing like furnace, with a woeful ballad
lines.speaker: JAQUES

lines.value: Made to his mistress' eyebrow. Then a soldier,
lines.speaker: JAQUES

lines.value: Full of strange oaths and bearded like the pard,
lines.speaker: JAQUES

lines.value: Jealous in honour, sudden and quick in quarrel,
lines.speaker: JAQUES

lines.value: Seeking the bubble reputation
lines.speaker: JAQUES

lines.value: Even in the cannon's mouth. And then the justice,
lines.speaker: JAQUES

lines.value: In fair round belly with good capon lined,
lines.speaker: JAQUES

lines.value: With eyes severe and beard of formal cut,
lines.speaker: JAQUES

lines.value: Full of wise saws and modern instances;
lines.speaker: JAQUES

lines.value: And so he plays his part. The sixth age shifts
lines.speaker: JAQUES

lines.value: Into the lean and slipper'd pantaloon,
lines.speaker: JAQUES

lines.value: With spectacles on nose and pouch on side,
lines.speaker: JAQUES

lines.value: His youthful hose, well saved, a world too wide
lines.speaker: JAQUES

lines.value: For his shrunk shank; and his big manly voice,
lines.speaker: JAQUES

lines.value: Turning again toward childish treble, pipes
lines.speaker: JAQUES

lines.value: And whistles in his sound. Last scene of all,
lines.speaker: JAQUES

lines.value: That ends this strange eventful history,
lines.speaker: JAQUES

lines.value: Is second childishness and mere oblivion,
lines.speaker: JAQUES

lines.value: Sans teeth, sans eyes, sans taste, sans everything.
lines.speaker: JAQUES

lines.speaker: DUKE SENIOR

lines.value: DUKE FREDERICK
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: Not see him since? Sir, sir, that cannot be:
lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.speaker: DUKE FREDERICK

lines.value: Rosalind, I am that he, that unfortunate he.
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: But are you so much in love as your rhymes speak?
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: ORLANDO
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: Neither rhyme nor reason can express how much.
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: ROSALIND
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: Love is merely a madness, and, I tell you, deserves
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: the reason why they are not so punished and cured
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: are in love too. Yet I profess curing it by counsel.
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: ORLANDO
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: Did you ever cure any so?
lines.speaker: ORLANDO

lines.value: ROSALIND

lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: his love, his mistress; and I set him every day to
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: woo me: at which time would I, being but a moonish
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: youth, grieve, be effeminate, changeable, longing
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: and liking, proud, fantastical, apish, shallow,
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: inconstant, full of tears, full of smiles, for every
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: passion something and for no passion truly any
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: thing, as boys and women are for the most part
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: cattle of this colour; would now like him, now loathe
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: him; then entertain him, then forswear him; now weep
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: for him, then spit at him; that I drave my suitor
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: from his mad humour of love to a living humour of
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: madness; which was, to forswear the full stream of
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: the world, and to live in a nook merely monastic.
lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.speaker: ROSALIND

lines.value: ROSALIND
